intro: Cheiranthus incanus, commonly known as the hoary stock, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its grayish-green, hairy leaves and yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open fields or along roadsides. Cheiranthus incanus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
